2022-07-03T16:59:22Z: We'll head off to find answers to that and much, much more as the F1 paddock digests this afternoon's action at Silverstone. Thanks for sharing the British GP with us. Have a lovely rest of your Sunday!
2022-07-03T16:55:20Z: Given how the race was shaping up, Leclerc will be searching for answers about Ferrari's call not to pit him when the safety car came out, as he lost out on the hards with Sainz, Perez and Hamilton on the softs.
2022-07-03T16:53:04Z:
Here's the full report on a dramatic British GP: 
https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-british-gp-sainz-takes-maiden-win-in-dramatic-race-as-title-challengers-struggle/10332505/
2022-07-03T16:51:31Z: Action and talking points everywhere you look, and the best news of all is both Albon and Zhou appear to be OK after the huge first corner crash.
2022-07-03T16:49:04Z: Quick bit of housekeeping, the incident between Schumacher and Verstappen has been reviewed and won't be investigated - so the Red Bull driver will keep seventh place.
2022-07-03T16:46:49Z: So, has everyone got their breath back? What a race.
2022-07-03T16:40:56Z: TV shots show Zhou by Alfa Romeo team trucks speaking to team boss Fred Vasseur and F1 chief Stefano Domenicali. So good to see that he is OK.
2022-07-03T16:31:39Z: TV shots show Zhou by Alfa Romeo team trucks speaking to team boss Fred Vasseur and F1 chief Stefano Domenicali. So good to see that he is OK.
2022-07-03T16:27:23Z: The Schumacher vs Verstappen incident at Brooklands has been noted by the stewards for forcing another driver off the track.
2022-07-03T16:25:17Z: Hamilton picked up the bonus point for fastest lap, a 1m30.510s on the final lap of the race.
2022-07-03T16:25:04Z: Vettel brings his Aston Martin home in ninth after becoming involved in the opening lap crash that red flagged the race. Kevin Magnussen rounded out the top 10 to cap a strong double points finish for Haas.
2022-07-03T16:24:34Z: There will be no further action on the Perez vs Hamilton and Perez vs Leclerc incidents, so the results will stay as they are.
2022-07-03T16:23:41Z: Leclerc holds on to fourth place ahead of Alonso and Norris, as Verstappen barely keeps seventh place from Schumacher. Vettel and Magnussen round out the points.
2022-07-03T16:23:06Z: Verstappen just managed to hold Schumacher for seventh despite almost making contact at the final corner. Schumacher scores his first points in Formula 1. A great drive from the Haas driver.
2022-07-03T16:22:03Z: ...and Sainz wins the British Grand Prix! What a race! Perez takes second and Hamilton completes the podium. Wow.
2022-07-03T16:21:21Z: Schumacher tries to pass Verstappen but is squeezed out at Luffield.
2022-07-03T16:21:19Z: Perez has nothing in response to Sainz as he rounds the final corners...
2022-07-03T16:20:05Z: Final lap time and Sainz leads by 3.9s and is on course for his maiden F1 win.
2022-07-03T16:18:57Z: The incident involving Perez and Hamilton, when the Red Bull put a blunt move on the Mercedes to regain second, has been noted by the stewards for forcing another driver off the track.
2022-07-03T16:17:34Z: On lap 50 Sainz leads by 3.4s from Perez, Hamilton is third 2.7s back and Leclerc is now defending from Alonso and Norris.
2022-07-03T16:17:30Z: Verstappen is now fending off Schumacher in the battle for P7. Battle everywhere at the minute!
2022-07-03T16:16:11Z: This is mega! The battle continues a lap later as Hamilton goes around the outside at Luffield and Woodcote, only for Leclerc to bite back at Copse. But Hamilton has the momentum and DRS on the Hangar straight to make it stick.
2022-07-03T16:14:41Z: On lap 47, Leclerc forces Hamilton to look around the outside of Stowe but there's no way through.
2022-07-03T16:13:24Z: Sainz has this in the bag, he is 4.1s clear after that battle, with Perez in second from Leclerc, Hamilton and Alonso.
2022-07-03T16:12:28Z: Hamilton then gets pushed wide by Perez at Abbey and that lets Leclerc by as well. Hamilton goes from fourth to second to fourth in five corners!
2022-07-03T16:11:27Z: Leclerc, hurting on those old hards, defends from Perez into Copse and then Vale, they both run wide and Hamilton sweeps by both at the final corner! Amazing racing!
2022-07-03T16:10:32Z: Schumacher passes Vettel for P8 as the battle for the minor points paying positions rages on.
2022-07-03T16:09:56Z: Sainz has cleared off at the front and leads by 2.5s as DRS is enabled.
2022-07-03T16:09:16Z: Hamilton is fighting back on Perez as he goes alongside into Copse - Mercedes vs Red Bull at that corner, we've seen that before - but Perez defends well to keep third.
2022-07-03T16:09:04Z: Verstappen has picked off Vettel for seventh now.
2022-07-03T16:08:04Z: Verstappen manages to climb back to P8 as Magnussen drops behind the Red Bull and Haas team-mate Schumacher.
2022-07-03T16:07:39Z: Sainz overtakes Leclerc for the lead down the Wellington straight and into Brooklands! Perez gets by Hamilton further back and he is up to third!
2022-07-03T16:06:38Z: Leclerc makes the jump into Vale and we are racing again, Hamilton is defending from Perez rather than attacking the Ferraris!
2022-07-03T16:05:41Z: We've had a lot of action in this race, and get ready for a stormer of a finale. Leclerc takes control of the field.
2022-07-03T16:05:37Z: The reason for Ocon's retirement is believed to be a fuel pump issue.
2022-07-03T16:03:44Z: The safety car is in this lap - so it will be a 10-lap sprint to the finish.
2022-07-03T16:02:47Z: As the order shuffles itself out its Vettel in P7 ahead of Magnussen, Verstappen and Schumacher. Magnussen appeared to stay out during the safety car period.
2022-07-03T16:02:09Z: Norris, who pits a lap later than the rest to go to softs, loses a spot to Alonso and drops to sixth place.
2022-07-03T16:00:59Z: Vettel maintains P7 after electing to stop under the stoppage. Verstappen reclaims P8 but both Haas cars are now in the points. Schumacher sits ninth with Magnussen rounding out the top 10, with 12 laps remaining.
2022-07-03T16:00:01Z: Perez is also a big winner in this, as he was due to pit very shortly, so he gets a freebie under the safety car as he keeps fourth and comes out on the softs.
2022-07-03T15:58:25Z: Sainz and Hamilton both pit under the safety car for fresh softs - but Leclerc, in the lead, hasn't! More drama!
2022-07-03T15:58:11Z: The Safety car has been deployed due to Ocon's stricken Alpine on the way to Copse corner.
2022-07-03T15:57:29Z: Ocon is now slowly on the way to Copse and he stops on the track from P8.
2022-07-03T15:56:46Z: Gasly has now joined the list of retirements that stands at five drivers. Gasly, Bottas, Russell, Zhou and Albon are out of the race.
2022-07-03T15:56:24Z: But Hamilton responds immediately with a 1m31.521s to gain on both Ferraris.
2022-07-03T15:55:19Z: Leclerc is stretching the legs of his Ferrari, as he produces a fastest lap of 1m31.613s to extend his lead to 3.5s on Sainz, with the Spaniard told he also needs to fuel save to make his life that bit harder.
2022-07-03T15:54:51Z: Ocon manages to pass a struggling Verstappen with a dive underneath at Stowe. Ocon makes the move stick and steals P8.
2022-07-03T15:52:35Z: Behind the front three Norris pits and drops to fifth place, which promotes Perez up one spot.
2022-07-03T15:52:02Z: Ocon has now caught Verstappen in the battle for P8. The Alpine is looming large in the Dutchman's mirrors.
2022-07-03T15:51:42Z: Here's the state of play: Leclerc leads by 1.8s from Sainz with Hamilton 4.2s off in third. Hamilton's tyres are eight laps fresher than Leclerc's and 13 laps fresher than Sainz's.
2022-07-03T15:49:22Z: Hamilton pits at the end of lap 33 and takes on the hards, it is a slow stop of 4.3s, and he comes out in third 3.4s off Sainz.
2022-07-03T15:48:09Z: Leclerc puts in a 1m31.837s, a new fastest lap, to go two-tenths quicker than Hamilton last time around.
2022-07-03T15:48:02Z: Now Ocon has got into P9 he has opened a gap over Latifi and is now setting his sights on a struggling Verstappen who is not far up the road. Schumacher now passes Latifi for P10.
2022-07-03T15:46:54Z: 20 laps to go in this race, which has been truly enthralling, with Hamilton leading by 18.7s from Leclerc but the Mercedes driver is still due to pit.
2022-07-03T15:45:16Z: Ah, not for long, as Sainz lets his Ferrari team-mate overtake on the Wellington straight. Team orders at work there.
2022-07-03T15:44:30Z: Leclerc is within DRS range of Sainz and looks for a move at Copse but backs out. Both are losing time and this is playing into Hamilton's hands.
2022-07-03T15:43:15Z: Ocon takes P9 from Latifi with a clean move on the Williams driver at Vale.
2022-07-03T15:41:25Z: Hamilton responds, a 1m32.265s, but Leclerc's next lap is a 1m32.021s and he's not in DRS range of Sainz in front.
2022-07-03T15:40:53Z: There is a great battle brewing for P9 with 0.4s separating Latifi and Ocon.
2022-07-03T15:39:58Z: Leclerc has fired up his hards quickly, as he sets a new fastest lap of anyone with a 1m32.060s. That puts him 1.4s behind Sainz.
2022-07-03T15:39:02Z: Hamilton leads and stays out on the mediums, but he will need to pit at some point in this race to change compound having gone from mediums to mediums in the red flag.
2022-07-03T15:37:42Z: Leclerc takes on hards and comes out in third place behind Sainz by 2.2s.
2022-07-03T15:36:15Z: Leclerc pits from the lead, just as Hamilton closed to within one second of him. This is a critical stage of the race.
2022-07-03T15:35:24Z: Following the latest round of pit stops, Latifi and Ocon now round out the top 10.
2022-07-03T15:31:55Z: A challenging British GP for Alfa Romeo is capped with a mechanical retirement for Valtteri Bottas. The Finn brings the car into the pits to retire, he had been sitting in the points following the clash between the two AlphaTauri drivers.
2022-07-03T15:30:54Z: Leclerc now leads by 2.4s from Hamilton, as the Mercedes driver is told the Ferrari is carrying front wing damage. He's in the hunt, you know.
2022-07-03T15:29:52Z: Here is a bit of an update on Alex Albon following that nasty crash on the opening lap.  https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/albon-taken-to-hospital-after-british-gp-crash/10332475/
2022-07-03T15:29:22Z: Sainz pits from the lead, trading his mediums for a set of fresh hards on lap 21, and the Spaniard comes back out in third place, right in front of Norris.
2022-07-03T15:28:34Z: Perez is into the points now in P10 as Latifi, who sitting P8, and Schumacher from P11 pit.
2022-07-03T15:28:08Z: Verstappen, in the injured Red Bull, remains in sixth place, 10s behind Alonso and his pace is slower than the Alpine.
2022-07-03T15:26:30Z: What's more, Hamilton is closing the gap on both Ferraris, as he cuts the gap to Leclerc to 3.2s. Sainz has been given the hurry up over team radio.
2022-07-03T15:25:15Z: A charging Perez continues to make progress. The Red Bull driver is up to P13 and is now behind the two Haas entries of Schumacher and Magnussen.
2022-07-03T15:24:54Z: Ferrari has a dilemma on its hands. Sainz is told his target lap time is 1m32.9s but he is four-tenths of a second off that. Leclerc is asking for a way past as he feels he can go faster.
2022-07-03T15:21:34Z: So, Sainz leads but Leclerc is within DRS behind in a Ferrari 1-2 and Hamilton is third just 4.2s behind.
2022-07-03T15:20:15Z: Verstappen has picked up bodywork damage, he is told it is not critical but he will suffer a performance drop. He is currently one second per lap slower than the frontrunners in sixth place.
2022-07-03T15:19:47Z: Tsunoda has been handed a five second penalty for causing a collision with Gasly.
2022-07-03T15:18:09Z: Perez climbs to P15, he manages to get by a recovering Tsunoda.
2022-07-03T15:17:41Z: Verstappen reports he hit some debris at Copse and then slowed dramatically. The Red Bull driver pitted for fresh mediums and comes back out in sixth place.
2022-07-03T15:16:56Z: Nightmare for AlphaTauri! Both drivers were in the points. Gasly down to P13 with Tsunoda in P15 after the clash. Rule one: Never make contact with your team-mate.
2022-07-03T15:15:58Z: Verstappen has a puncture and pits at the end of lap 12! Sainz leads again! This race!
2022-07-03T15:15:23Z: The AlphaTauri pair of Tsunoda and Gasly have collided heading into the Loop! They both spin. Ocon moves up to P7 with Latifi P8. Bottas and Ricciardo move into the points now.
2022-07-03T15:14:48Z: So that was made pretty easy for Verstappen, who now leads by 1.3s at the end of lap 11. Leclerc is all over the rear of Sainz in the fight for second now.
2022-07-03T15:13:41Z: Meanwhile, Perez is on a charge and posts the fastest lap with a 1m33.362s. The Mexican driver is sitting in P16 after damaging his front wing, which required a pit stop.
2022-07-03T15:13:09Z: Sainz goes wide! He goes off at Becketts and takes to the grass, which allows Verstappen to sweep by and take the lead on the Hangar Straight.
2022-07-03T15:10:37Z:
FIA update on the lap 1 crash: Two drivers involved in the incident at the start of the race were checked in the medical centre. There were no major injuries. The driver of Car 24 (Zhou) is under observation in the medical centre. The driver of Car 23 (Albon) will be transferred by helicopter to Coventry Hospital for precautionary checks. 
The driver of Car 63 (Russell) was checked by medical staff and was declared fit.
2022-07-03T15:10:09Z: Verstappen duly gets DRS and is closing in on the leader. Both are on mediums after changes during the red flag, so no tyre advantage either way.
2022-07-03T15:08:42Z: Perez's unscheduled pit stop has put him to the rear of the field in P17. It could be a long afternoon from there for the Red Bull driver. However, he has already made a spot with a move on Vettel.
2022-07-03T15:08:23Z: Sainz leads Verstappen by 1.0s at the start of lap eight, meaning the Red Bull driver is edging towards DRS range.
2022-07-03T15:07:04Z: The Verstappen vs Leclerc clash will not be investigated by the stewards, while Ferrari have reported front wing damage for their driver too.
2022-07-03T15:06:57Z: Perez's pit stop means Alonso sits P6 ahead of Gasly, Tsunoda, Ocon and Latifi is now back in the points for Williams.
2022-07-03T15:05:47Z: Alonso has put his Alpine ahead of Gasly for P6 as Perez comes in for a service.
2022-07-03T15:05:38Z: Hamilton dives by Norris into Brooklands on lap six to take fourth place.
2022-07-03T15:05:15Z: Perez pits at the end of lap five due to his front wing damage which releases Norris into fourth and Hamilton into fifth.
2022-07-03T15:04:33Z: DRS is enabled for the first time in this race, but Sainz is already over a second ahead of Verstappen. Perez's front wing damage is hurting his pace and he's being caught up Norris and Hamilton.
2022-07-03T15:03:35Z: It all settles down for the rest of the lap, Perez has front wing damage from that clash with Leclerc. Sainz leads from Verstappen, Leclerc and Perez. Norris is fifth from Hamilton.
2022-07-03T15:02:41Z: Alonso challenges Gasly for P7 but the latter hangs on. Tsunoda sits in P9 and Ocon moves into the final points position in P10.
2022-07-03T15:02:35Z: Leclerc and Perez bash wheels on the charge on to the Wellington straight, with Sainz leading Verstappen ahead of them, and then Leclerc makes a wheel-on-wheel contact with Verstappen at Brooklands. What a restart lap!
2022-07-03T15:01:15Z: Sainz keeps the lead this time but is super aggressive, pushing Verstappen towards the pitwall and over the kerbs at the first turn. That invites Perez and Leclerc to fight for the lead!
2022-07-03T14:59:48Z: Sainz, on pole, takes his place on the grid with the rest lining up behind him. Here. we. go. again.
2022-07-03T14:58:22Z: The cars are on the track behind the safety car, which will peel into the pits ahead of the standing start.
2022-07-03T14:57:52Z: Russell also says he stopped the car jumped out to see if Zhou was ok and when he returned the car was on the back of the lorry. The Mercedes driver is frustrated that he is unable rejoin the race as his car only had a puncture. The rules state a car has to reach Safety Car 2 line under its on steam to be able to rejoin the race in this situation.
2022-07-03T14:56:16Z: It will be a standing start for the restart.
2022-07-03T14:55:47Z: Quick reminder on where we are at: The British GP will restart on lap 2 of 52, with Russell, Albon and Zhou out of the race. The race time clock stopped with 1hr59m39s left at the red flag, but the time limit will end the race at 6pm local time if that arrives first.
2022-07-03T14:48:55Z: Hamilton hops off his scooter and into the Aston Martin garage, so he may want to hurry up to make the restart. Sainz is already in his Ferrari and ready to go.
2022-07-03T14:46:39Z: The British GP will resume at 15:56 local time - so that's in 10 minutes.
2022-07-03T14:41:23Z:
Here's the developing story on the start crash:
https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/zhou-conscious-after-massive-silverstone-f1-turn-1-crash/10332434/
2022-07-03T14:40:30Z: Just to clear up the final points of the first lap shunt. Tsunoda and Ocon picked up damage from Albon's spinning Williams. The pair are set to join the restart.
2022-07-03T14:39:41Z: Full grid order for the restart: Sainz, Verstappen, Leclerc, Perez, Hamilton, Norris, Alonso, Latifi, Gasly, Bottas, Tsunoda, Ricciardo, Ocon, Magnussen, Vettel, Schumacher, Stroll.
2022-07-03T14:38:12Z: The restart order is set to be Sainz ahead of Verstappen - in effect a full restart.
2022-07-03T14:35:09Z: Replays confirm its was contact from Vettel that sent Albon into his accident. A very messy start to the British Grand Prix.
2022-07-03T14:30:38Z: Behind, Albon found the pit wall to the right after rear to front contact from an Aston Martin.
2022-07-03T14:28:59Z: Replays show just how lucky Zhou was, as his car is flipped, skidded on its roll hoop before digging into the gravel trap. The car eventually ends up between the back of the tyre barrier and catch fencing.
2022-07-03T14:24:42Z: It is still unclear how Albon got caught in that incident. It appears work is now being carried out at the crash scene to remove Zhou's car which seems to have landed on top of the tyre barrier.
2022-07-03T14:24:08Z: Russell's damaged Mercedes is back in the paddock, not yet in the garage, but it appears the team is assessing the damage to see if they can repair the car in time for the restart.
2022-07-03T14:22:35Z: The FIA advises that following the incident at the start of the race, emergency crews were immediately in attendance, and the drivers of Car 23 (Albon) and Car 24 (Zhou) have been taken to the medical centre. Both drivers were conscious and will be evaluated at the medical centre. Further updates will be given in due course.
2022-07-03T14:21:28Z: Alfa Romeo team boss Frederic Vasseur has told Sky that he thinks Zhou was conscious throughout the scary incident.
2022-07-03T14:20:05Z: There is also reports of protestors getting on to the track on the first lap, with police and marshals quickly on the scene. More news on it when we get it.
2022-07-03T14:18:27Z: It appears the incident was triggered when Russell and Gasly made contact which sent Russell into a jink, clipping Zhou into a frightening roll.
2022-07-03T14:16:23Z: Zhou is understood to be out of the car. The Alfa Romeo team says he is okay. He is on a stretcher and being taken away from the scene.
2022-07-03T14:14:00Z: Zhou is still in the Alfa Romeo according to reports.
2022-07-03T14:13:14Z: The cars of Tsunoda and Ocon are being repaired in the pits.
2022-07-03T14:12:38Z: The stewards have reviewed the start incident and declared no further investigation will be needed.
2022-07-03T14:08:49Z: The extraction team are on the scene and are carefully righting Zhou's Alfa Romeo.
2022-07-03T14:08:11Z: At the front before the first-corner crash and red flag, Verstappen got the jump on Sainz to take the lead and Hamilton also made a mega start to get into third. Leclerc is fourth ahead of Alonso and Perez.
2022-07-03T14:08:00Z: There is damage to the front right of Ocon's Alpine. He is limping to the pits.
2022-07-03T14:07:34Z: Russell is out of his Mercedes, his race is over.
2022-07-03T14:07:22Z: The field has returned to the pits under this red flag.
2022-07-03T14:06:17Z: George Russell also picked up damage in that crash and Yuki Tsunoda was also involved but is moving with damage to the front of his AlphaTauri.
2022-07-03T14:05:41Z: Alex Albon was involved in the multi car shunt. His Williams has stopped on track.
2022-07-03T14:04:53Z: There was an Alfa Romeo upside down! It was Zhou.
2022-07-03T14:04:09Z: Verstappen does make the most of the soft tyres to lead but there is carnage at the back and there is a red flag!
2022-07-03T14:02:40Z: All drivers complete the formation lap without any dramas and are lining up on the starting grid. Here. we. go.
2022-07-03T14:00:48Z: So, Verstappen has the theoretical faster tyre for the start against Sainz, but can he make it count? We'll find out very soon as the formation lap is underway.
2022-07-03T13:59:18Z: Behind the frontrunners, Latifi, Magnussen, Vettel and Schumacher are also all on the softs while the rest of the drivers start on the mediums.
2022-07-03T13:58:28Z: Tyre talk: Verstappen starts on the softs but Sainz, Leclerc, Perez, Hamilton, Norris and Alonso are all on the mediums. Russell, in eighth, starts on the hards. That's quite a mix.
2022-07-03T13:50:29Z: The guests on the grid are being ushered away so it is nearly time for the serious business. Who are you backing?
2022-07-03T13:49:00Z: Air temp is a mild 17.8c and track temp is 27.7c - which is warm for Silverstone.
2022-07-03T13:47:40Z: The risk of rain has officially been put at 20% - fair to middling.
2022-07-03T13:45:02Z: Time for the British national anthem, sung and played by Sam Ryder of Eurovision runner-up fame.
2022-07-03T13:42:16Z: Ferrari mechanics are hard at work on Leclerc's car on the grid, with the FIA's Jo Bauer watching on. Trouble afoot?
2022-07-03T13:35:31Z: The grid is filling up with the cars in their slots surrounded by team personnel, media and VIPs. It is a real celeb-spotter.
2022-07-03T13:31:36Z:
It wasn't always that way, as there was just one home winner of the British GP between 2001-13: when Hamilton splashed to his maiden Silverstone triumph in 2008.
That race makes it into the list of Autosport writers' favourite British GPs: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/autosport-writers-favourite-f1-british-grands-prix/10329715/
2022-07-03T13:27:58Z: The Silverstone F1 race has been started and finished with the British national anthem for seven of the last eight years, but for the same to happen today might be a tall order. Hamilton, winner of those races, starts fifth in front Norris, with Russell in eighth.
2022-07-03T13:23:45Z: The pitlane is open and the drivers are taking to the track with a sprinkling of rain in the air. Just to add that extra spice.
2022-07-03T13:20:30Z:
Back to the main event, here's a qualifying recap: Sainz claimed his maiden F1 pole in a thriller in the wet, beating Verstappen who joins him on the front row. Leclerc took third ahead of Perez, Hamilton and Norris.
Full qualifying report here: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-british-gp-qualifying-report/10331778/
2022-07-03T13:18:31Z: What made Mansell and the Williams FW14B so special? Let Autosport big cheese Kevin Turner explain:
2022-07-03T13:14:43Z:
Not a bad way for Vettel to celebrate his 35th birthday. Happy birthday, Seb!

Nigel Mansell, Sebastian Vettel
Photo by: Andy Hone / Motorsport Images
2022-07-03T13:12:11Z: And turn up the sound on this for maximum enjoyment:
2022-07-03T13:10:41Z:
Before we start, a short view back to the past, and this one is pretty cool. Ahead of the drivers' parade Vettel did a demo run in Mansell's Williams FW14B, the car that won the British GP 30 years ago.

Sebastian Vettel, Williams FW14B
Photo by: Luke Smith
2022-07-03T13:06:36Z: Good afternoon, fancy another chapter from the British GP novel? Oh, go on then.
